title:
Scalar perturbations on the normal and self-accelerating branch of a DGP
  brane and $\sigma_8$
authors: Maribel Hern\'andez M\'arquez, Celia Escamilla Rivera
abstract:
In this work we constrain the value of $\sigma_8$ for the normal and
self-accelerating branch of a DGP brane embedded in a five-dimensional
Minkowski space-time. For that purpose we first constrain the model parameters
$H_0$, $\Omega_{m0}$, $\Omega_{r0}$ and $M$ by means of the Pantheon+ catalog
and a mock catalog of gravitational waves. Then, we solve numerically the
equation for dark matter scalar perturbations using the dynamical scaling
solution for the master equation and assuming that $p=4$ for the matter
dominated era. Finally, we found that the evolution of matter density
perturbations in both branches is different from the $\Lambda$CDM model and
that the value of $\sigma_8=0.774\pm0.027$ for the normal branch and
$\sigma_8=0.913\pm0.032$ for the self-accelerating branch.
